comments.html:
With CloudFlare, Akamai and a number of other CDN providers offering 6-to-4 translation service, these excuses become totally lame.

As for AWS, they started offering IPv6 on the outside years ago. Getting IPv6 running on the inside will take quite a while, as they do routing in their custom virtual switch.
comments.name: Ivan Pepelnjak

comments.html: This comment has been removed by the author.
comments.name: JeffTP

comments.html:
"We still have time to implement IPv6" and "Our provider does not support IPv6" was what I got when I asked for IPv6 for two popular websites (see http://blog.quux.de/?p=1893 and http://blog.quux.de/?p=1898).

Looks like many of the big cloud providers have no or only limited IPv6 support.IIRC there was a longer discussion about aws and IPv6 on the nanog mailing list earlier this year.
comments.name: Jens Link

comments.html:
Oh no, not again... did anyone take a look at the calendar lately?

SCE, ACE, vASA, IronPort, Nexus 5500, Nexus 1000V, ACI... will it never end? At least they fixed some of these products (and killed a few others).
comments.name: Ivan Pepelnjak

comments.html:
Is Cisco Meraki still considered a Startup? ;-)
But for sure, they will also suport IPv6 eventually .. (hopefully)
